content.raw: We've been trying to change the API to follow Google's Style guide, which [says](https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#General_Naming_Rules) to "**capitalize the abbreviations or acronyms as single words**". Mind changing the new functions to `Bvh` instead of `BVH`?
content.html: We've been trying to change the API to follow Google's Style guide, which says to "capitalize the abbreviations or acronyms as single words". Mind changing the new functions to Bvh instead of BVH?

pullrequest.title: add bvh animation support for skeleton

content.raw: Thanks. Bvh is better than BVH:grinning:
content.html: Thanks. Bvh is better than BVH

pullrequest.title: add bvh animation support for skeleton

content.raw: Unlike Gazebo, Ignition Common is in the `ignition` namespace. So we can drop the `ignition::` from all code to make lines shorter and easier to read.
content.html: Unlike Gazebo, Ignition Common is in the ignition namespace. So we can drop the ignition:: from all code to make lines shorter and easier to read.

pullrequest.title: add bvh animation support for skeleton

content.raw: Is there a reason to use `Matrix4d` for both translation and rotation, instead of using lighter types like `Vector3d` for translation and `Quaterniond` for rotation?
content.html: Is there a reason to use Matrix4d for both translation and rotation, instead of using lighter types like Vector3d for translation and Quaterniond for rotation?

pullrequest.title: add bvh animation support for skeleton

content.raw: Oh, the name `AlignRotation` might be misleading. The functions `AlignTranslation` and `AlignRotation` return the transformations for the alignment. Since the transformations need to be applied to the frames on different sides \(left multiply or right multiply\), I use the translation and rotation to make a difference. Both functions need to return the `Matrix4d` transformation.
content.html: Oh, the name AlignRotation might be misleading. The functions AlignTranslation and AlignRotation return the transformations for the alignment. Since the transformations need to be applied to the frames on different sides (left multiply or right multiply), I use the translation and rotation to make a difference. Both functions need to return the Matrix4d transformation.

content.raw: The new `TrajectoryInfo` class also looks good to me. Since it's brand-new and it's basically just holding data, it should be straight-forward to add a few unit tests for it. Let's see if we have time for it this week, otherwise we can merge without tests and add tests in the future.

content.raw: How about using `std::chrono::steady_clock::duration` for `Duration` and `std::chrono::steady_clock::time_point` for `StartTime` and `EndTime`? Chrono can be a bit tricky to work with, let me know if you have questions :wink:
content.html: How about using std::chrono::steady_clock::duration for Duration and std::chrono::steady_clock::time_point for StartTime and EndTime? Chrono can be a bit tricky to work with, let me know if you have questions

content.raw: What's the difference between a "keyframe" and a "trajectory" here? Should this just say "start time of this trajectory"?
content.html: What's the difference between a "keyframe" and a "trajectory" here? Should this just say "start time of this trajectory"?

pullrequest.title: add bvh animation support for skeleton

content.raw: Sorry for the confusion. Yes, it should be “start time of this trajectory”. Also for `duration` and `endTime`.
content.html: Sorry for the confusion. Yes, it should be “start time of this trajectory”. Also for duration and endTime.

content.html:
LGTM! I just have a few minor suggestions which can be done when merging:

diff -r 60c1d7765226 graphics/include/ignition/common/Animation.hh
--- a/graphics/include/ignition/common/Animation.hh     Fri Aug 23 01:16:31 2019 +0800
+++ b/graphics/include/ignition/common/Animation.hh     Thu Aug 22 12:14:41 2019 -0700
@@ -18,7 +18,6 @@
 #define IGNITION_COMMON_ANIMATION_HH_

 #include <map>
-#include <memory>
 #include <string>
 #include <vector>

diff -r 60c1d7765226 graphics/src/Animation.cc
--- a/graphics/src/Animation.cc Fri Aug 23 01:16:31 2019 +0800
+++ b/graphics/src/Animation.cc Thu Aug 22 12:14:41 2019 -0700
@@ -374,10 +374,8 @@
 {
   this->dataPtr->id = _trajInfo.dataPtr->id;
   this->dataPtr->animIndex = _trajInfo.dataPtr->animIndex;
-  this->dataPtr->startTime = std::chrono::steady_clock::time_point(
-                                _trajInfo.dataPtr->startTime);
-  this->dataPtr->endTime = std::chrono::steady_clock::time_point(
-                                _trajInfo.dataPtr->endTime);
+  this->dataPtr->startTime = _trajInfo.dataPtr->startTime;
+  this->dataPtr->endTime = _trajInfo.dataPtr->endTime;
   this->dataPtr->translated = _trajInfo.dataPtr->translated;
   this->dataPtr->waypoints = _trajInfo.dataPtr->waypoints;
   this->dataPtr->segDistance = _trajInfo.dataPtr->segDistance;
diff -r 60c1d7765226 graphics/src/Animation_TEST.cc
--- a/graphics/src/Animation_TEST.cc    Fri Aug 23 01:16:31 2019 +0800
+++ b/graphics/src/Animation_TEST.cc    Thu Aug 22 12:14:41 2019 -0700
@@ -160,7 +160,6 @@
   EXPECT_DOUBLE_EQ(4.0, trajInfo.DistanceSoFar(500ms));

   waypoints.clear();
-  std::cout << waypoints.size() << std::endl;
   // duration from start == 0
   waypoints[TP(200ms)] = math::Pose3d(1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
   // duration from start == 2000ms
